title: Data Analyst / Researcher - Warsaw based
description:
Company overview

Zinc Network is a global communications business helping its government and private-sector clients tackle complex social issues through strategic communications. The company is focused on achieving social impact primarily in partnership with government and the private sector.

We create and deliver award-winning campaigns that tackle some of the world’s toughest social problems; from countering extremism to bridging the digital literacy gap among seniors to boosting mental health well-being in young people.

We design, implement and evaluate creative and communications campaigns that change the way people think, feel and behave across a range of issues. We specialise in working with multiple stakeholders; including government, NGOs, charities and media organisations. We’re a full-service agency and provide clients with research, strategy, creative, technical, production, marketing and evaluation expertise.

Our strategic thinking informs our creativity, and our... strategy is driven by an ‘always-on’ approach to audience feedback and insights.

Purpose of this role

To understand how our audiences think and feel, enabling us to prove that our work has sustainable and ongoing impact and, crucially, articulating the findings to our clients.

What’s the role?

We are looking for a Researcher to who is confident with data capture, storage and analysis to support our project team with Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) activities for a media development project across Central and Eastern Europe.

What you’ll be doing:

• Designing data collection methodologies, conducting analysis and writing reports in conjunction with the project team;
• Telling a story with our data, both for internal project teams and clients;
• Developing long form impact reports for clients;
• Planning and managing resources effectively;

• Managing any relevant junior research staff and/or subcontractors (including market research fieldwork agencies) as necessary to achieve project objectives, seeking best value at all times;
• Working with our MEL lead in London to deliver learning at Zinc;
• Be a champion for our subject knowledge and expertise by collecting our research and insights on key thematics and turning it into insight.

Requirements

What we need from you:

• Excellent written English and another language: Polish, Romanian, Bulgarian, Slovenian, Hungarian
• 2+ years' experience in MEL
• A quantitative research focus
• Excellent command of quantitative research methodologies
• Strong data processing and analysis skills with an eye for accuracy
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (esp. PowerPoint and Excel)

• Strong numeracy skills
• Ability to present data in an accessible manner, both longform written reports and engaging PowerPoint presentations
• Experience of media research
• Confident in presenting to senior level clients
• Experience of line managing junior team members and giving feedback on work

• Thrives working within a small team and shaping and developing your role
• Be able to think strategically and turn insights into actionable business recommendations
• Experience of working on new business pitches and new business leads
• Experience of conducting research across multiple markets
• Experience using SPSS or Q Software

• Regional expertise (Eastern Europe)
• (Not essential) Experience of working with social media data

Lastly, we’re committed to hiring a diverse workforce from different professional and cultural backgrounds, and to that end we encourage a variety of people to our company to represent the diverse range of subjects associated with our projects

description:
Data Analyst - Risk. The rear view mirror.

As Data Analyst - Risk you will help to ensure that machine learning models and other safeguards used to protect SumUp continue to align with a good customer experience. Risk Analytics forms the backbone of our business. As Data Analyst - Risk, you will be responsible for providing analytics not only to our tribe but also to the Risk Platform’s customers across the entire organisation. Using your proven track record of success in a similar environment, together with your team you will build a roadmap and strategy, setting a vision for the Risk Analytics function at Sumup and drive execution according to this vision.

In the role of Data Analyst - Risk you will be analyzing structured data (risk, transaction risk, account security, form models, account take over) and use the outcome of this analysis to advise the business, supporting Data Scientists and Product Teams by creating model-based decision strategies to generate “bottom-line”... business benefits through the optimization of product offers and related experiences across all platforms.

Your objective lies in making sure that the rest of the company is well informed and able to use Risk data to generate actionable insights empowering our business partners to produce optimal customer experiences through innovations in data-driven decision making.

What you’ll do:
• Contribute to building data insights to help the team take the right decision, enabling good and stopping bad in all our checkpoints
• Support planning and prioritization processes by providing data driven value estimation of competing initiatives
• Suggest and be able to take decisions on how to find and obtain the required data
• Building dashboard with key KPIs, metrics and performance indicators
• Liaise between Product, Business and Data Science teams to ensure that business requirements are understood and prioritised
• Provide thought leadership on how we present data and how we can improve

You’ll be great for this role if you have:
• Minimum 3+ years of experience in analytics, with at least 2 of those years in product or product-adjacent analytics
• Experience in the risk domain would be beneficial
• Payment industry experience (highly desired)
• Clear and efficient communication, coupled with evident enthusiasm for leading a team and helping people grow
• Ability to operate on a cross organsational level with multiple business and technical stakeholders
• Demonstration of advanced SQL ability; Python or R knowledge is a plus
• Experience building dashboards using tools such as PowerBI, Tableau or similar

Why you should join SumUp
• Help build a world class risk platform using the latest technologies and industry practices
• You will be part of a global analytics community, with opportunities for collaboration, knowledge sharing, and ongoing training & development.

• The opportunity to work on large scale FinTech products used by millions of businesses around the world.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the existing growth team in Product Madness and to ensure we are using the right data for the right decisions. Your key responsibilities will be to:
• Work closely with other team members, data engineers and business stakeholders to ensure the data we are consuming is clean, robust and relevant.

• Proactively work with our partners such as Apple, Google, Appsflyer etc. to ensure we maintain our ability to derive insights from the data we are provided with.

What We're Looking For

To do this successfully we believe you are:
• Passionate about quantitative analysis and will have the ability to generate actionable business insights for the growth team, game teams and Product Madness as a whole.
• Intuitive with regards to data interpretation, e.g. spotting anomalies without giving it a second thought.
• Having a good understanding of core statistical concepts and techniques.

Requirements
• 2+ years work experience as a data analyst or data scientist in a similar field
• Advanced knowledge of SQL
• Experience with visualization tools such as Looker/Tableau/etc.
• Strong in mathematics and quantitative analysis with a passion for numbers and data
• Fluent in English

Why Product Madness?
